image.altText: Indigenous woman looks out the window from the rundown kitchen.

props.synopsis: A class action has been filed against the West Australian government on behalf of thousands of tenants living in substandard public housing in remote Aboriginal communities.Â

title.children: WA government hit with class action over shambolic state of regional public housing

image.altText: Arborists search for signs of the shot-hole borer beetle in Perth's Hyde Park

props.synopsis: A tree-killing beetle on the move across Perth is likely being spread beyond quarantine boundaries by people unaware of its existence, one scientist warns.

title.children: How those being blamed for the spread of a tiny tree-killing pest might not even be aware of its existence

image.altText: Aerial screenshot showing Wyalkatchem townsite and yellow dots representing tremors

props.synopsis: Geoscience Australia says there could be more earthquakes in the WA Wheatbelt "for days and weeks to come" after multiple tremors over the past week.

title.children: Country WA residents told to get ready for more earthquakes after swarm

image.altText: A man taking a photo of himself through the reflection of a car side mirror

props.synopsis: A fly-in, fly-out worker lured women and teenagers online using dating apps like Sugar Daddy before drugging and sexually assaulting them at his home while filming them, a Perth court is told.

title.children: FIFO worker who lured women, teens on Sugar Daddy app filmed himself raping them while they were unconscious, court told

image.altText: Bill Shorten during QT

props.synopsis: The federal government has cleared its political hurdle with states and territories to reform the NDIS, but it now faces a very apprehensive disability community.

title.children: What happens now the government has support for its contentious NDIS reforms?

image.altText: Close up portrait of blond shorthaired woman with glasses

props.synopsis: News Corporation journalist Samantha Maiden gives evidence in the defamation action launched by Linda Reynolds against Brittany Higgins over a series of social media posts the senator believes were defamatory.

title.children: 'Greatest moments in journalism': Texts between Brittany Higgins and reporter who broke story aired

image.altText: Matt Wearn, who won back-to-back gold in the sailing, waving and wearing medal getting off plane from Paris

props.synopsis: Dual-Olympic gold medallist Matt Wearn has said it is a shame most athletes do not get to reap the rewards for their success at the Olympics.

title.children: After claiming gold for his country, West Aussie Matt Wearn is back to juggling his professional sport and day job

image.altText: Three planes on a tarmac at dusk

props.synopsis: The ABC understands Singaporean F15s capable of producing a sonic boom were flying overhead when a loud 'explosion' sound was felt in Perth this morning.

title.children: Singaporean F15s capable of sonic boom flying over Perth as 'huge rumble' felt

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and his government stand up in parliament with their hands clasped, looking solemn.

props.synopsis: Beyond the heat in the chamber, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together behind the scenes on important reforms.

title.children: Beyond the arguments and name-calling, the two sides of politics have been quietly working together

image.altText: The ceramic demijohn with text 'J&W Bateman Wine and Spirit Merchants, Fremantle' will be preserved by WA Museum.

props.synopsis: Maritime archaeologists identify the earliest known shipwreck in the Swan River, a cargo barge wrecked in an 1882 storm, which provides a glimpse into life in 19th-century Perth.Â

title.children: Maritime researchers uncover 1882 shipwreck in Perth's Swan River

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch speaking while wearing his police uniform.

props.synopsis: Commissioner Col Blanch says an internal review is underway into how the trial of two alleged gold thieves was abandoned before it could begin.

title.children: Commissioner confirms WA Police review into forensics 'error' that saw alleged gold thieves walk free

image.altText: A close up of Bill Clinton laughing at an event with a purple backdrop

props.synopsis: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz will formally accept the Democratic party nomination for vice-president on the third day of the Democratic National Convention, where former US president Bill Clinton will give the keynote speech. Follow live.

title.children: Bill Clinton, Nancy Pelosi and VP pick Tim Walz headline third day of Democratic National Convention

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump holds rally in Asheboro, North Carolina behind bulletproof glass
What can we expect from Tim Walz's address?

image.altText: Five rescue workers sit in high-viz outfits on a boat

props.synopsis: The discoveries bring the number of people killed in the incident to six, with authorities still searching for one other passenger.

title.children: Five bodies found in billionaire Mike Lynch's superyacht, which sank off Italian coast

image.altText: Micaela Cronin stares up on stage at the national press club.

props.synopsis: Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner Micaela Cronin addressed the National Press Club on Wednesday facing a room almost entirely of women, but it seemed she was trying to reach the ears of a different demographic.

title.children: Australia just got graded on how it's tackling violence against women, and it's a C-

image.altText: A portrait photo of Elon Musk. He is a white man with short black hair and brown eyes, wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: Data provided exclusively to the ABC shows Tesla's "brand health" in Australia has plummeted as some EV buyers say, "Musk has convinced me I don't want to buy a Tesla".

title.children: Does Tesla have a Musk problem? Data shows its reputation in Australia is tanking as sales fall

image.altText: Pink roses.

props.synopsis: A bouquet of flowers is the go-to gift for many special occasions but the world is paying a high price for transporting our out-of-season blooms.

title.children: The ugly truth behind the cheap flowers we buy at the supermarket checkout

image.altText: Aftermath of missile attack in Russia's Kursk

props.synopsis: Russia's Ministry of Defence says it shot down a swathe of Ukrainian drones in one of Kyiv's "largest attempts" to attack Moscow using drones.

title.children: Kyiv's Russian counteroffensive continues with 'largest' attempted drone attack

image.altText: Hannah Green driving on the 18th tee at St Andrews Old Course

props.synopsis: Australia's golf aces get their ninth and last crack of the year to capture a major championship when the Women's Open Championship begins on Thursday.

title.children: Green, Lee lead Aussie charge for Open Championship at St Andrews

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: There are fresh warnings that Australia's economy is heading toward a recession, as Deloitte flags a private sector hiring freeze. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX to open higher despite fresh warnings on Australia's economy

image.altText: A McLaren F1 car is on the inside of a barrier after a crash, while the RB is hoisted into the air to remove it from track

props.synopsis: The last time Daniel Ricciardo attended the Dutch Grand Prix, his season was derailed by a crash with his fellow countryman.

title.children: 'Turned upside down': Ricciardo returns to site of crash which derailed last season

image.altText: A man wearing a white tshirt and shorts, taking a photo by the beach as the sun sets.

props.synopsis: Above-average temperatures are forecast all across Australia as we reach the tail end of winter. But is the cold weather truly behind us?

title.children: Winter records under threat from prolonged spell of summery weather

image.altText: A woman sitting on a couch cuddling a newborn baby, both are asleep.

props.synopsis: Ariane Beeston worked as a child protection officer for years, but she didn't realise how much the trauma of her work had impacted her until she had a child of her own.

title.children: How the vicarious trauma of a job led to this mother's postnatal psychosis

image.altText: A river winding through bushland with cleared land in the distance.

props.synopsis:
FOI documents shared with the ABC reveal current chief minister Eva Lawler approved the NT's largest water plan while the environment minister was on holiday, with no water advisory committee and against the wishes of traditional owners.Â 

Â

title.children: Eva Lawler sworn in as environment minister two days before approving controversial water plan

image.altText: Comanchero Outlaw Motorcycle Gang clothing, methamphetamine, phones, cash and other items laid out on the ground.

props.synopsis: Police in Tonga say an alleged Comancheros gang member deported from Australia was behind moves to establish the outlaw motorcycle group in the Pacific island â an attempt they say was disrupted in a drug bust this month.

title.children: Tonga police swoop on alleged Comanchero gang member once deported from Australia

image.altText: Pile of frozen pea packets

props.synopsis: Supermarkets are seemingly offering more brands of frozen veggies than ever â but is the increasing choice an illusion?

title.children: The rise of 'phantom brands' as supermarket giants sneak imports onto shelves, pushing Australian produce out

image.altText: Linda Burney

props.synopsis: Linda Burney, the first Aboriginal woman to enter the House of Representatives, makes her departing speech, saying the failed Voice referendum can still be a catalyst for change.

title.children: Voice to Parliament can still be a force for good, says Linda Burney, as she farewells politics

image.altText: A large group of people, many Indigenous, standing in a bush clearing with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Young Aboriginal people say they are fed up with abuses of power from those in authority, empty promises and a culturally insensitive education system. At the NT's Garma Festival, they got together to create a vision for the future.

title.children: Indigenous teens issue powerful call for overhaul of 'traumatising' school system

image.altText: A photo of a Melbourne train platform overlaid with black and white static.

props.synopsis: Hospital equipment in Melbourne has been affected by "electromagnetic interference" after test runs of the new Metro Tunnel. What is it and can it be fixed?

title.children: Melbourne's new Metro Tunnel is being tested. Why is it affecting MRI machines?

image.altText: A destroyed combat vehicles sits n the side of the road, alongside other destroyed cars.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian forces are believed to have used Australian-supplied Bushmasters as part of their recent surprise incursion into Russia, with evidence emerging of at least one of the armoured vehicles apparently destroyed inside the western border region of Kursk.

title.children: Burnt-out Bushmaster apparently found in Kursk after incursion into Russian territory

image.altText: A graphic reading death certificate

props.synopsis: Medical staff at Tasmania's second-largest hospital say what the public know is just "the tip of the iceberg" when it comes to unexpected deaths going unreported to the coroner.

title.children: 'I can't put you through': Doctor claims he wasn't allowed to contact coroner after patient's death

image.altText: Ruthy Hewson getting hair cut

props.synopsis: Growing up, Ruthy Hewson felt salons didn't know how to care for her textured hair. Today, hairdressers are working to change the stigma that afro-textured hair can be difficult to style.

title.children: 'We can be beautiful with our natural hair': Stylists working to improve salon experience for all hair types

image.altText: Merle Thornton at the Regatta Hotel at Toowong in Brisbane

props.synopsis: In 1965 Merle Thornton AM and a friend chained themselves to a bar at the Regatta Hotel in Brisbane in protest of a ban on women drinking in public bars. It became regarded as a pivotal moment in women's liberation in Australia.Â

title.children: Merle Thornton, who fought for the right for women to drink at public bars, dies aged 93
